git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/42/259442/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Data Source placeholders support -------------------------------- Sahara supports special strings that could be used in data sources URLs. These strings will be replaced with appropriate values during job execution that allows to use the same data source as an output multiple times. There are 2 types of string currently supported: * ``%JOB_EXEC_ID%`` - this string will be replaced with the job execution ID * ``%RANDSTR(len)%`` - this string will be replaced with random string of lowercase letters of length ``len``. Real URLs after placeholders replacing are stored in ``data_source_urls`` field of job execution object. This allows to use them later to find objects created by a particular job run.

commit_message:
Use git.openstack.org everywhere

Our official git master is at git.openstack.org, update places
that use github instead.

Also update repository, it's project-config now instead of config, and
the location of the files has been adjusted for this change.

Change-Id: Idb54c721cf2b88c79cc32f070f31cbc2f20d513c

Add OS::Senlin::Profile resource to heat.

Change-Id: I50b5854edd449eca144bd7f42d4d9a37c2241c2c

added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # Copyright 2015 IBM Corp. from heat.common.i18n import _ from heat.common import template_format from heat.engine import attributes from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine import resource from heat.engine import support class Profile(resource.Resource): """A Resource for Senlin Profile. """ support_status = support.SupportStatus(version='6.0.0') default_client_name = 'senlin' entity = 'profile' PROPERTIES = ( NAME, SPEC, METADATA, ) = ( 'name', 'spec', 'metadata', ) ATTRIBUTES = ( ATTR_NAME, ATTR_TYPE, ATTR_METADATA, ATTR_ID, ATTR_SPEC, ) = ( "name", "type", 'metadata', 'id', 'spec', ) properties_schema = { NAME: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Name of the senlin profile. By default, physical resource name ' 'is used.'), ), SPEC: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('The spec template content for Senlin profile.'), required=True ), METADATA: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, _('Metadata key-values defined for profile.'), ) } attributes_schema = { ATTR_NAME: attributes.Schema( _("Profile name."), type=attributes.Schema.STRING ), ATTR_TYPE: attributes.Schema( _("Profile type."), type=attributes.Schema.STRING ), ATTR_METADATA: attributes.Schema( _("Profile metadata."), type=attributes.Schema.MAP ), ATTR_ID: attributes.Schema( _("Profile ID."), type=attributes.Schema.STRING ), ATTR_SPEC: attributes.Schema( _("The spec template for the profile."), type=attributes.Schema.MAP ), } def handle_create(self): spec = template_format.simple_parse(self.properties[self.SPEC]) params = { 'name': (self.properties[self.NAME] or self.physical_resource_name()), 'spec': spec, 'metadata': self.properties[self.METADATA], } profile = self.client().create_profile(**params) self.resource_id_set(profile.id) def handle_delete(self): if self.resource_id is not None: try: self.client().delete_profile(self.resource_id, ignore_missing=True) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) def _resolve_attribute(self, name): profile = self.client().get_profile(self.resource_id) return getattr(profile, name, None) def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Senlin::Profile': Profile }

commit_message:
Use git.openstack.org everywhere

Our official git master is at git.openstack.org, update places
that use github instead.

Remove contributors link, it's not available on git.openstack.org.

Fix capitalization of OpenStack.

Change-Id: I9a1b5ca6769d63eea84f31de2e7485af78799c3d

commit_message:
Fix token_endpoint usage

Commit 22d740b7007e1182c99370cb2629322384b17a14 broke token_endpoint
authentication for openstackclient, by unconditionally setting
auth_type to 'token' whenever a token was passed in the command line.

This change reverts the portion that always overrides the auth plugin
if there is a token passed via arguments.

Change-Id: I835c3716dd08eaca10f56682c22fdc6ac700e0fe

commit_message:
Using LOG.warning replace LOG.warn


*Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
*https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
*so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I07ee9c97c3548c965aaf83d34b37b23e9baba584

commit_message:
Replace dashes with underscores in bash completion

Property escaped_name is added to CompleteShellBase class to retrieve
name without dashes.

Change-Id: Ibc46a2f3a096f2b56826cdb623a37886c1c6b6f9
Closes-bug: #1374579
Co-authored-by: Neil Borle <neil.borle@emc.com>

commit_message:
Add OVS parse flows method

This method parse the flows into easy to work with
dictionaries.
In next patches this will be used to construct tests
checking the installed flows.

Change-Id: I50f2c204a250d63e89dafc524c09a06ae1974dc9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/45/262145/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: full_args = ["ovs-ofctl", "dump-flows", 'br-int', '-O Openflow13'] def _parse_ovs_flows(self): flows = self._get_ovs_flows() flow_list = flows.split("\n")[1:] flows_as_dicts = [] for flow in flow_list: fs = flow.split(' ') res = {} res['table'] = fs[3].split('=')[1] res['match'] = fs[6] res['packets'] = fs[4].split('=')[1] res['actions'] = fs[7].split('=')[1] res['cookie'] = fs[1].split('=')[1] flows_as_dicts.append(res) return flows_as_dicts
deleted_lines: full_args = ["ovs-ofctl", "dump-flows", 'br-int']

commit_message:
Quota API is now compatible with keystone API v2

Before, the quota API used to fail to perform calls with specified
keystone API v2, because the keystone client used in code was set
to v3 and all quota operations used to assume that the user would
use only keystone API v3.
Now, we use the generic client, which discovers the version of the
keystone API, so depending on that, the quota API can perform
appropriate operations.

Change-Id: I32595a37a9fe74ede77c92f76e0865f4c9371f65
Closes-Bug: 1517043

commit_message:
Set timeout for parmiko ssh connection

Set manila-server connection timeout enabled via configuration
file on generic driver to prevent ssh connections getting
stuck if manila-server is slow in responding or some network
problems occur.

Closes-Bug: #1528203
Change-Id: Icd72c561aa37fad447e3f6e1eade3b2f57d74521

commit_message:
Use a joined relationship for AZ info on routers

This patch adds a joined relationship from the routers
to the agent table to prevent excessive DB lookups of the
agent availability zones during router listings.

This fix is the same as the one for networks here:
I908ceb1a68e0eed7c304e3ff82279ad6fa406167

A follow-up patch will add an AZ table so this doesn't
have to join directly to the agents table.

Change-Id: I808f8ff0c581478b2ea1144e297d83af599a32f2
Closes-Bug: #1526644

commit_message:
Make redirects happen in correct order

It should redirect stdout to /dev/null firstly,
then redirect stderr to whatever stdout currently points at.

Change-Id: Ibbf5592c4b74f5c7978ed493bf50b6e3de28f12c

commit_message:
Fix repeatedly enter the same string (fake-service)

The variable ENABLED_SERVICES is assigned to fake-service,
No need to repeat fake-service in the following code
by make use of it.

Change-Id: Ia3d2edc6291c895c81ac5692fab6a80f84c0b009

Check and return nova server health status

added_lines: def test_do_check(self): profile = server.ServerProfile('t', self.spec) nc = mock.Mock() nc.server_get.return_value = None profile._novaclient = nc test_server = mock.Mock() test_server.physical_id = 'FAKE_ID' res = profile.do_check(test_server) self.assertFalse(res) return_server = mock.Mock() return_server.status = 'ACTIVE' nc.server_get.return_value = return_server res = profile.do_check(test_server) self.assertTrue(res)

commit_message:
Use git.openstack.org everywhere

Our official git master is at git.openstack.org, update places
that use github instead.

Also, remove one reference to DocBook as content for our documentation -
since that is outdated.

Change-Id: I48772ef4da24b609ed359628935784f92865568b

commit_message:
API: cleanup in rescue api

The schema of rescue requires request contain rescue in the REST api request
body, so no need to check it again in code.

Change-Id: I12e1670d7840e0b6616c04a0f9cb3de151d300e8

commit_message:
Wrong usage of "an"

Wrong usage of "an" in the messages:
"the optional os_options paramater includes an non-empty"
"We are allowing to have an tenant_name argument"

Should be:
"the optional os_options paramater includes a non-empty"
"We are allowing to have a tenant_name argument"

Totally 2 occurrences in python-swiftclient base code.

Change-Id: I2f2f7e07432fedfee5ccb418d9505250b3fed597

subject: libvirt: add encrypted rbd volume support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-28 15:03:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f1cb1fd60005a9b9864b56c31ca0aab3d7f05942', 'message': 'libvirt: add encrypted rbd volume support

Currently the LibvirtNetVolumeDriver handles rbd as remote network
device where qemu actually does the volume attach/detach as it speaks rbd
natively.

However for encrypted rbd volumes this is not the case and we do need to
attach/detach the volumes on the hypervisor properly.

The simplest way to achieve this is to wrap the existing functionality
into a separate volume driver that handles the encrypted case but refers
all other functionality back to the LibvirtNetVolumeDriver.

As the encryptors rely on an external symlink mapping (possibly by udev?)
under /dev/disk/by-id/* which is not present with rbd so we also need to
take care of creating and removing the symlink - hence the update to the
rootwrap filter.

Change-Id: I4b5c65d6c719a837674a1809dd1cec12c0df1ebc
Closes-Bug: #1463525

commit_message:
libvirt: add encrypted rbd volume support

Currently the LibvirtNetVolumeDriver handles rbd as remote network
device where qemu actually does the volume attach/detach as it speaks rbd
natively.

However for encrypted rbd volumes this is not the case and we do need to
attach/detach the volumes on the hypervisor properly.

The simplest way to achieve this is to wrap the existing functionality
into a separate volume driver that handles the encrypted case but refers
all other functionality back to the LibvirtNetVolumeDriver.

As the encryptors rely on an external symlink mapping (possibly by udev?)
under /dev/disk/by-id/* which is not present with rbd so we also need to
take care of creating and removing the symlink - hence the update to the
rootwrap filter.

Depends-On: Ic36eb8195b57778687dcf362256e1d5f069c8ab6

Change-Id: I4b5c65d6c719a837674a1809dd1cec12c0df1ebc
Closes-Bug: #1463525
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/76/206576/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py:ln: RegExpFilter, ln, root, ln, --symbolic, --force, /dev/(rbd|disk\/by-path|mapper)/.*, .* # nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py: rm: RegExpFilter, rm, root, rm, /dev/disk/by-path/rbd-volume-.*
deleted_lines: ln: RegExpFilter, ln, root, ln, --symbolic, --force, /dev/mapper/.*, .*

subject: Add new cluster status RESIZING
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-28 08:45:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin/commit/8d966f8592b0ea040155a6178f341056b3bb54f0', 'message': 'Add new cluster status RESIZING

commit_message:
signature_utils: refactor the list of ECC curves

In the signature utils code and tests, we repeat the set of ECC curves
four times. Refactor the code so that we've only one such list.

Introduce a SignatureKeyType class which encapsulates all the info about
each signature key type and which also maintains a registry of key
types.

In a subsequent patch, this refactoring makes it easier to only register
ECC curves which are available on the platform.

Related-Bug: #1528393

Change-Id: Ic9fa1bd2149fdcdc3fc27688f6e8b141b23d8757
Signed-off-by: Mark McLoughlin <markmc@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/76/260276/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Do not use api-paste.ini osprofiler options

Starting with opsrofiler 0.3.1 release there is no need to set HMAC_KEYS
and ENABLED arguments in the api-paste.ini file, this can be set in the
cinder.conf configuration file.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I17b89ffdf5613103be83284ddf8549e963a69c4f

commit_message:
Migrate Site Model to Pod Model

As we discuss, pod is a more suitable term to represent bottom
OpenStack instance, so migrate Site model to Pod model. Also the
original Site API is removed and README is updated.

Change-Id: I3bf9b8150866cafaba371e7911d8016650b0532b

subject: Munge region_name to '' if set to None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-29 22:27:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config/commit/033b59770a57edceb7d377009034738566eac079', 'message': "Use _get_regions in _get_region

In 8fa5570 the _get_region method started calling a new
_get_known_regions instead of _get_regions. _get_known_regions had most
of the functionality of _get_regions but it excluded the base case
where no region could be found. Since get_one_cloud calls _get_region
in order to set the region, no region key would get set if a region
couldn't be found. This resulted in an error in bifrost[1], which does
not use any cloud config file and does not set the region name
explicitly anywhere ._get_regions calls _get_known_regions and includes
that base case, so use that instead.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/482831/

Change-Id: I22cce104930f74dd479e704cc1a941dc945b75de
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-29 23:39:55.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_config.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config/commit/17e019a08e6e8fed7da6d0de403e5525d997095b', 'message': "Munge region_name to '' if set to None

The openstack ansible module defaults to setting region_name to
None[1]. With region_name explicitly set, _get_region won't use '' as a
default and therefor has unexpected behavior if the user does not set
the region explicitly. This is apparent in bifrost[2] which does not
use any cloud config file and does not set the region explicitly. This
patch checks whether None was passed in as the region name and sets it
to '' so that it can continue processing it as though it was not set.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/module_utils/openstack.py#L41
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/482831/

Change-Id: I22cce104930f74dd479e704cc1a941dc945b75de
"}]
commit_message:
Munge region_name to '' if set to None

The openstack ansible module defaults to setting region_name to
None[1]. With region_name explicitly set, _get_region won't use '' as a
default and therefor has unexpected behavior if the user does not set
the region explicitly. This is apparent in bifrost[2] which does not
use any cloud config file and does not set the region explicitly. This
patch checks whether None was passed in as the region name and sets it
to '' so that it can continue processing it as though it was not set.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/module_utils/openstack.py#L41
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/482831/

Change-Id: I22cce104930f74dd479e704cc1a941dc945b75de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/28/262328/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Use is_supported() to check microversion

Method is_supported from api_version_request.py could
be used in several places to check support of microversions.

commit_message:
Remove duplicate default=None for option compute_available_monitors

In oslo.config, all type config options have default value None if
don't set parameter default. So don't need set config option
compute_available_monitors' default value with None in Nova.

Change-Id: I843e0ca4339ceefa54a7441ca245b8bc73d0139e

commit_message:
Fix wrong flake8 exception and pep8 violations

In the tox.ini, [flake8] section, "exclude =
.venv,.tox,dist,doc,openstack,*egg". From this rule, all 'openstack'
directories are excluded. This rule is intended to exclude
manila/openstack/common code check, but this is wrong
because it also exclude checks against manila/api/openstack and
manila/tests/api/openstack. We should fix it

Change-Id: Ie820e3931e83a82c40b0d9b9d943787a5d6ec363
Closes-Bug: #1529092

Fix the ref error When tox -e docs
Warning, treated as error:
doc/config-reference/source/block-storage/drivers/nfs-volume-driver.rst:80:
WARNING: undefined label: enabled_backends (if the link has no caption the
label must precede a section header)

commit_message:
Avoid duplicating tenant check when creating resources

When the Neutron Controller processes a "create" request, it
will check that the tenant_id is valid and add it to the
resource dict. Hence, the _get_tenant_id_for_create() can be removed,
as proposed in Neutron.

Change-Id: I31022e9230fc5404c6a94edabbb08d2b079c3a09
Partial-Bug: 1513825
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas refs/changes/64/259064/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: tenant_id = self._get_tenant_id_for_create(context, firewall['firewall']) tenant_id, context, firewall)

commit_message:
Adds configuration support for OpenDaylight SDN Controller

In order to use OpenDaylight with Neutron, ML2 must be configured to
point to the OpenDaylight controller instance.  It also requires the
networking-odl python library to drive communication with ODL.
Additionally each Open vSwitch instance must be configured to set the ODL
Controller as it's manager.

Change-Id: If067e1057bec2d48f700838d86077a550bd27bd2
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 45954a106abc107b7d260b5d16b2e3c6c592893c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/43/259243/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Configure OVS to use OpenDaylight # # === Parameters # # [*tunnel_ip*] # (required) The IP of the host to use for tunneling # tenant VXLAN/GRE over # # [*odl_username*] # (optional) The opendaylight controller username # Defaults to 'admin' # # [*odl_password*] # (optional) The opendaylight controller password # Defaults to 'admin' # # [*odl_check_url*] # (optional) The URL used to check ODL is available and ready # Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:8080/restconf/operational/network-topology:network-topology/topology/netvirt:1' # # [*odl_ovsdb_iface*] # (optional) The ODL southbound interface for OVSDB # Defaults to 'tcp:127.0.0.1:6640' # # [*provider_mappings*] # (optional) bridge mappings required if using VLAN # tenant type. Example: provider_mappings=br-ex:eth0 # Defaults to false # # [*retry_interval*] # (optional) The time (in seconds) to wait between ODL availability checks # Defaults to 60 # # [*retry_count*] # (optional) The number of ODL availability checks to run before failing # Defaults to 20 # class neutron::plugins::ovs::opendaylight ( $tunnel_ip, $odl_username = 'admin', $odl_password = 'admin', $odl_check_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:8080/restconf/operational/network-topology:network-topology/topology/netvirt:1', $odl_ovsdb_iface = 'tcp:127.0.0.1:6640', $provider_mappings = false, $retry_interval = 60, $retry_count = 20, ) { # Handle the case where ODL controller is also on this host Service<| title == 'opendaylight' |> -> Exec <| title == 'Wait for NetVirt OVSDB to come up' |> exec { 'Wait for NetVirt OVSDB to come up': command => "/bin/curl -o /dev/null --fail --silent --head -u ${odl_username}:${odl_password} ${odl_check_url}", tries => $retry_count, try_sleep => $retry_interval, } -> # OVS manager exec { 'Set OVS Manager to OpenDaylight': command => "/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl set-manager ${odl_ovsdb_iface}", unless => "/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl show | /usr/bin/grep 'Manager \"${odl_ovsdb_iface}\"'", } -> # local ip exec { 'Set local_ip Other Option': command => "/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl set Open_vSwitch $(ovs-vsctl get Open_vSwitch . _uuid) other_config:local_ip=${tunnel_ip}", unless => "/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl list Open_vSwitch | /usr/bin/grep 'local_ip=\"${tunnel_ip}\"'", } # set mappings for VLAN if $provider_mappings { exec { 'Set provider_mappings Other Option': command => "/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl set Open_vSwitch $(ovs-vsctl get Open_vSwitch . _uuid) other_config:provider_mappings=${provider_mappings}", unless => "/usr/bin/ovs-vsctl list Open_vSwitch | /usr/bin/grep 'provider_mappings' | /usr/bin/grep ${provider_mappings}", } } }

subject: tempest: Update after the recent tempest change
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-18 06:29:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/tests/tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/test_fwaas.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/commit/e1718f04049bf9f91b5f85fe348a5d9a9468005b', 'message': 'tempest: Update after the recent tempest change

tempest: Update after the recent tempest change

A recent tempest change [1] moved the config to a different group.
This change updates our plugin to refer the new location.

[1] I1908e37d2551760831e338788511db93d5129e16

commit_message:
tox_install: Fix "already installed" test

For many of projects, the name of projects are slightly different from
the name of modules.  eg. neutron_fwaas vs neutron-fwaas.

Closes-Bug: #1514280
Change-Id: I9027ce89f09e85085ce5ce1c7d3da872c840b94f
(cherry picked from commit ad281aba09f66852ce94faf1e01826e9dea70e73)
Conflicts:
        tools/tox_install.sh
        tools/tox_install_project.sh
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/64/255964/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MOD=$2 shift 2neutron_installed=$(echo "import ${MOD}" | python 2>/dev/null ; echo $?) echo "ALREADY INSTALLED" > /tmp/tox_install-${PROJ}.txt echo "${PROJ} already installed; using existing package" echo "ZUUL CLONER" > /tmp/tox_install-${PROJ}.txt echo "PIP HARDCODE" > /tmp/tox_install-${PROJ}.txt
deleted_lines: shift 1neutron_installed=$(echo "import ${PROJ}" | python 2>/dev/null ; echo $?) echo "ALREADY INSTALLED" > /tmp/tox_install.txt echo "Neutron already installed; using existing package" echo "ZUUL CLONER" > /tmp/tox_install.txt echo "PIP HARDCODE" > /tmp/tox_install.txt

commit_message:
Retyping volume got error under max vol limit

After reaching the max volume limit and
retyping one of volumes, cinder will raise
error: "VolumeLimitExceeded".

This error shouldn't be occurring since the
volume type limit is -1 and retyping doesn't
change the volume quota, it changes the volume
type quota.

Change-Id: I5f25c47158ac24bef94078457a84248daa67e80f
Closes-Bug: #1504719

commit_message:
Show availability_zone info in CLI neutron agent-list

Like nova service-list, we should show availability zone information
in agent-list result. It will leave empty if the agent is not belong
to any zone.

Change-Id: I210b3668c247f06b0c14debe22409ce99836e024
Partially-implements: blueprint add-availability-zone

commit_message:
Fix TracedMeta class

We shouldn't .pop() trace_private from trace_args because it will
work only for first method in class.

Change-Id: Id713d1a1a9452bbdd2f58fde9499159cdfc0a037
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/88/262088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: trace_args = dict(getattr(cls, "__trace_args__", {})) trace_private = trace_args.pop("trace_private", False) if not trace_private and attr_name.startswith("_"):
deleted_lines: trace_args = getattr(cls, "__trace_args__", {}) if (not trace_args.pop("trace_private", False) and attr_name.startswith("_")):

commit_message:
remove keystoneclient.apiclient.exceptions

these have been deprecated in favor of keystoneclient.exceptions
for a very long time. let's finally remove them.

Change-Id: I0fc06a12647a0faac5ba98ed83118269efc304a6
Closes-Bug: 1526651
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/02/258302/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > keystoneclient.apiclient has been removed. critical: - > [`bug 1526651 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-keystoneclient/+bug/1526651>`_] The module `keystoneclient.apiclient` has been removed in favor of `keystoneclient.exceptions`. The aforementioned module has been depreacted since the v0.7.1 of keystoneclient which was inclued in the Juno release of OpenStack.

commit_message:
Add experimental jobs for multi-region testing

This change adds experimental jenkins jobs for heat and devstack-gate
in order to test a multi-region environment in devstack-gate as
proposed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/200309/.

commit_message:
Catch all errors in Mock detector

It turns out that some modules may throw exceptions
other than ImportError from their class members.
The mock detector should ignore those.

Change-Id: I513c573982250e24b94ec5e649cf2c9e2799334c
Closes-Bug: 1524918

commit_message:
Replace github with git.openstack.org

This commit updates the website copy, replacing repository links that
pointed to github.com with git.openstack.org. Since the repos at
github.com are read-only replicas, we should not direct users to
github. There is also danger of these replicas falling out of date in
addition to being fully unsupported.

Change-Id: I1f36c144ccab8e9140f427fcacb82d7812654741

commit_message:
Add instance create int-tests

Add generic integration tests for instance create.
Also moved some global constants to the base runner.

Note: Did some additional cleanup work on other test groups as well.
      Broke down some negative tests into more self-contained units.
      Added a comment string on tests that did not have it.
      Had to fix database_actions test to work for users defining
      hosts (like MySQL users).

Change-Id: I7c1413fa5742c276454e26ebbbeae8e02569a392

subject: Fix cmdline string parser
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-29 13:33:48.000000000', 'files': ['iso/ks.template'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/cdf019aa1668610dd9170d2fa04f6cc0c1dadebb', 'message': "Fix cmdline string parser

cmdline string parser tries to avoid any part of cmdline that
contains dot, because it's key part (left from =) is
used as bash variable later, and it can't contain dots.
This isn't correct, since value part (rigth from =) can
contain dots too.

This request fixes this, replacing dots in keys to double underscores.
It also adds default value 'yes' for those cmdline parts that doesn't
contain '=' character.

Change-Id: I4687f843e0f1baddea71638301bb29aebc0a4fb8
Closes-bug: #1529854
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cmdline string parser

cmdline string parser tries to avoid any part of cmdline that
contains dot, because it's key part (left from =) is
used as bash variable later, and it can't contain dots.
This isn't correct, since value part (rigth from =) can
contain dots too.

This request fixes this, replacing dots in keys to double underscores.
It also adds default value 'yes' for those cmdline parts that doesn't
contain '=' character.

Change-Id: I4687f843e0f1baddea71638301bb29aebc0a4fb8
Closes-bug: #1529854
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/14/262214/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Parse cmdline to alter keys which contains dot in their names # Such keys can't be used as variables in bash, # so every dot is replaced with double underscore. # Double underscore needed to avoid possible naming collisions. for item in $(cat /proc/cmdline); do if [[ "${item}" =~ '=' ]]; then key="${item%%=*}" value="${item#*=}" else key="${item}" value='yes' fi key="${key//\./__}" value="${value:-'yes'}" echo "${key}=${value}" >> /root/anaconda.cmdline.vars
deleted_lines: for I in $(cat /proc/cmdline); do case "$I" in *=*) if ! [[ "${I}" =~ "." ]]; then echo "${I}" >> /root/anaconda.cmdline.vars; fi ;; esac

commit_message:
Add additional backend options for cinder

The following change adds the ability to configure the following
options for backends and volumes:

For dellsc_iscsi:
 + dell_sc_verify_cert

For glusterfs:
 + glusterfs_backup_mount_point
 + glusterfs_backup_share

For nfs:
 + nfs_mount_attempts

For rbd:
 + rados_connect_timeout
 + rados_connection_interval
 + rados_connection_retries
 + rbd_store_chunk_size

For glusterfs we are also removing the deprecated glusterfs_disk_util
which was removed in Icehouse.

Change-Id: I08dd7dbc9ad51d40a64a25119ca8692c068ca80c

Update cinder backends to use os_service_default

leverage the os_service_default fact.

commit_message:
Deprecate this package

The contents of this package have been moved into
keystoneauth1, so an application importing this package should
now get a warning telling them to stop using it and use the
keystoneauth1 version instead.

Change-Id: I9877a044f98bcb3479bd2d853aedd2d2a5b10b3b
Closes-Bug: 1512741
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient-kerberos refs/changes/05/253205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: python-keystoneclient-kerberos was an authentication plugin for keystoneclient that supported Kerberos. The contents have been moved into the keystoneauth1 package at https://pypi.python.org/pypi/keystoneauth1/ , and python-keystoneclient-kerberos will no longer be supported.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/51/258451/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Jenkins Slave ============= The Jenkins Slave is a machine that is set up to run build projects scheduled from the master. Slave runs a dedicated program called a "slave agent" spawned from the master, thus there is no need to install Jenkins itself on a slave. -------- Overview -------- ------------------------ Jenkins Slave deployment ------------------------ There are few ways to setup Jenkins master-slave connection, however in our infra currently we use only one of them. In general, the Jenkins master SSH-key is to be placed in authorized_keys file for the jenkins user on a slave machine. Then via the Jenkins Master's WebUI create a node manually by specifying slave's node FQDN. After, the Jenkins master will connect to the slave via SSH to the jenkins user, upload 'slave.jar' file and spawn it on slave using jenkins user. In order to deploy Jenkins Slave please choose an already existing hiera role for a specific jenkins instance or create a new one. For instance you can use 'jenkins_slave' role as a base start.

commit_message:
Removes MANIFEST.in as it is not needed explicitely by PBR

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a sensible
manifest from git files and some standard files and it removes
the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Ibb26e84f0def8f91c2cc61c2dc232fe396a4d9a4

commit_message:
Use stevedore.sphinxext to populate a new page listing all available drivers.

As per:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/073338.html

The point behind the addition of the stevedore.sphinxext extension is
"to document drivers and other types of plugins to make the available
sets built into projects easier to discover" (dhellman).

Change-Id: Ib40d081fc97936f2dfaa642d12ead02735b1879e

commit_message:
use debtcollector to deprecate keystoneclient-kerberos

The entire functionality of keystoneclient-kerberos is replaced
by keystoneauth. Start deprecating this project so we can move
it to openstack/attic long term.

Change-Id: I6c0d3001d15c925d561d26ff6c1fa7c3e708e52b

commit_message:
[Verify] Configure 'catalog_type' in 'data-processing' section

Sahara has two service types: 'data_processing' and 'data-processing'.
'data_processing' is deprecated, but it can be used in previous OpenStack
releases. So we need to configure the 'catalog_type' option to support
environments where 'data_processing' is used as service type for Sahara.

Change-Id: Iddd8da9dcde7ab0e0ea4f315fe78965e9b2474ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/74/260974/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
